meanings.sent1: She kept redenying her involvement in the prank.
meanings.sent2: He was redenying the accusations despite the evidence against him.
meanings.sent3: The cat was redenying the fact that it knocked over the vase.
meanings.sent4: The politician was redenying the scandal, hoping it would go away.
meanings.sent5: The child was redenying eating the cookies, crumbs all over his face.

meanings.definition: The act of denying something again.
meanings.sent1: Her redenying of the truth only made matters worse.
meanings.sent2: The redenying of responsibility led to further consequences.
meanings.sent3: The redenying of the lost keys delayed the search.
meanings.sent4: His redenying of the promise disappointed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The redenying of the request caused confusion among the team.

meanings.definition: The state of being in denial again.
meanings.sent1: His redenying of the situation showed his unwillingness to face reality.
meanings.sent2: The redenying of the problem only prolonged the inevitable.
meanings.sent3: Their redenying of the issue created tension within the group.
meanings.sent4: The redenying of the truth clouded their judgment.
meanings.sent5: The redenying of the mistake prevented any progress from being made.
